meanings.definition: To look up at something with admiration or wonder.
meanings.sent1: She upgazed at the stars twinkling in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The child upgazed at the colorful balloons floating in the air.
meanings.sent3: The puppy upgazed at the squirrel on the tree with curiosity.
meanings.sent4: As she upgazed at the towering waterfall, she felt a sense of awe.
meanings.sent5: He upgazed at the magnificent painting, taking in every detail.

meanings.definition: Past tense of upgaze: looked up at something with admiration or wonder.
meanings.sent1: They upgazed at the fireworks lighting up the sky last night.
meanings.sent2: She upgazed at the old castle, imagining its glorious past.
meanings.sent3: The cat upgazed at the bird perched on the roof, reminiscing its failed attempts to catch it.
meanings.sent4: He upgazed at the ancient ruins, feeling a connection to the past.
meanings.sent5: The students upgazed at the teacher, eager to hear the next exciting story.
